question.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>250</mn><mo> </mo><mi>mL</mi></math> of a waste solution obtained from the workshop of a goldsmith contains <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>1</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mo> </mo><msub><mi>AgNO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>0</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mo> </mo><mi>AuCl</mi></math>. The solution was electrolyzed at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math> by passing a current of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> for <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>15</mn></math> minutes. The metal/metals electrodeposited will be : <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mrow><msubsup><mtext>E</mtext><mrow><msup><mtext>Ag</mtext><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>/</mo><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mn>0</mn></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>80</mn><mtext>V</mtext><mo>,</mo><msubsup><mtext>E</mtext><mrow><msup><mtext>Au</mtext><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>/</mo><mtext>Au</mtext></mrow><mn>0</mn></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>69</mn><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mfenced></math>

options.text: silver and gold in proportion to their atomic weights
silver and gold in equal mass proportion

solution.text:
Charge (q)= it 96500F=1×15×6096500=90096500=9965F=0.0093 F

No. of moles of Au+=0.025 & No. of moles of Ag+=0.025

Species with higher value of SRP will get deposited first at cathode.

(i) Au+(aqs) + e-⟶ Au(s)

0.025          0.0093 mole 

so only Au will get deposited.
